defaultValue: Toggle specific functionality of Stellar Networks. You can fine-control each functionality in Modules section.

fieldDescription: Enable commodity board (buy, sell, and profit tabs).
Enable contacts board (contact list and remote calls) functionality.
Enable exploration board (managing intel in Exploration tab) functionality. Best consumed with Captains Log enabled.
Enable market query and market viewer functionality.
Enable storage board (search for cargo and view storage content and location) functionality.
Uninstall Stellar Networks during next save. Makes it possible to disable the mod and still continue the playthrough. Usually required when updating to a non-bugfix version.

When enabled, Commodity board and intel, and Market Queries and Viewer board, and query results intel will only be visible when within Comms range. Same restriction will be put on remote Contact call.
Maximum number of profit tables rows.
Minimum quantity to trade in order to add a profit table row.
Minimum profit to be made in order to add a profit table row.

Allow remotely calling Sebestyen, who is a hidden contact (does not normally show in a Contact intel).

[WARNING!]
Once Sebestyen is added he cannot be removed. Suspending him can break your Galatia Academy quest line.
Disallow remotely calling contacts which have missions in-progress. Fixes loophole where you could (for example) extract prisoners and immediately deliver" them via remote call."

defaultValue: Control which submarkets will be used when using Queries or Viewer board.

fieldDescription: When enabled, market queries will show results from Open Market.
When enabled, market queries will show results from Military Market.
When enabled, market queries will show results from Black Market.
When enabled, market queries will show results from custom (e.g. modded) markets.

Enable a plugin that will periodically 'visit' a market triggering, if needed, a cargo, ship, and staff refresh. Only runs when the campaign is in a paused state (either by the player, or by the game itself - like showing interaction dialogues). Has negligible game performance effect. Suggested to keep it on for smoother gameplay if you use market functionality.
Create fighter (LPCs), modspec, and weapon lists (for query building) using Codex. If disabled, will use known lists of visible factions.
Create ship lists (for query building) using Codex. If disabled, will use known lists of visible factions.
